fields.description:
ServerPropertiesTest showed the below output when running. The ping retries and the test passes. 
I am not sure if in fact a Connection reset is a valid response if the server is not fully up and the test is just being too verbose or if it is real problem that we get this Error.

fields.summary: ServerPropertiesTest prints .java.net.SocketException: Connection reset to console but test passes

comments.body:
I think this is actually a NetworkServer bug pingWithNoOpen should catch the IO exception and wrap it and then it would pass vetPing. I am not sure the best way to test.

There are a couple of prints to System.out on errors in pingForServerUp. I think maybe these should be removed and just throw the error so test runs that only check for failures and not stack traces in the run output will catch unexpected failures.
I tend to think that should be a separate checkin once tests settle down, so we don't introduce more volatility.  I will file a separate issue for that.
Here is a patch for this issue.  I am
Triage for 10.9

I am finally returning to this issue. Here is a patch derby-5610_trunkdiff.txt that I think will wrap the Socket exception with a localized DRDA Exception and then the test should get the exception it expect and not print to stdout.

I am not sure how to test the patch.  I also seem to recall being concerned about this fix at one point but cannot remember why.  I will work on seeing if I can force the SocketException with the patch to see what the behavior is.

URL: http://svn.apache.org/r1484507
Log:
DERBY-5610 ServerPropertiesTest prints .java.net.SocketException: Connection reset to console but test passes

Merged to 10.10 branch. Don't plan to go back further at this time.

Sending        java\drda\org\apache\derby\impl\drda\NetworkServerControlImpl.java
Transmitting file data .
Committed revision 1485264.
Will work on backporting this to 10.9 and 10.8
